job_description:
The Role
This is a full hands-on frontend role with strategic influence. You'll craft exceptional user interfaces for web and native mobile apps, working directly with our product-led CEO on both Innovation House projects (ElGrupito, PadelCrest) and diverse Agency clients. You'll participate in the complete product development cycle‚Äîfrom reviewing PRDs and specifications to implementing features, conducting QA, and iterating based on user feedback. You'll help shape our frontend architecture, processes, and design systems while managing multiple projects with high autonomy.
Our Development Approach: We follow the BMAD-METHOD ‚Äîa specifications-driven, full product cycle development framework. This means you'll work with detailed PRDs (Product Requirements Documents), implement BDD (Behavior-Driven Development) acceptance criteria, collaborate with AI agents throughout the development process, and ensure every feature you build aligns with documented specifications from conception to deployment.
Ready to join: We move fast. Ideal candidates can start full-time within 2-4 weeks. Our interview process is short and focused‚Äîtypically completed within 2 weeks.
 What you'll do
Full Product Cycle Ownership: Participate in PRD reviews, implement features from specifications, write and verify BDD acceptance criteria, conduct QA, and iterate based on user feedback
Cross-Platform Development: Build responsive web applications (Next.js, TypeScript) and native mobile apps using React Native with Expo framework‚Äîmaintaining shared codebases and platform-specific optimizations
Specs-Driven Development: Work within the BMAD-METHOD framework, translating detailed PRDs and specifications into production-ready code that meets documented acceptance criteria
Native App Expertise: Develop iOS and Android apps using Expo, leveraging Expo SDK, EAS Build, and native API integrations (camera, location, push notifications, etc.)
AI-Augmented Collaboration: Review and refine PRs from AI agents, collaborate with UX designers using Figma-to-code tools, and leverage AI platforms (Magic UI MCP, v0.dev) to accelerate development
Design System Implementation: Translate Figma designs into production-ready, high-fidelity components using shadcn/ui and maintain consistent design systems across web and mobile
Performance & Quality: Optimize for Core Web Vitals, implement WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility standards, write comprehensive tests, and ensure cross-platform consistency
Technical Leadership: Help shape frontend architecture, establish best practices, and mentor team members on modern development workflows
Multi-Project Management: Handle multiple initiatives across Innovation House products and Agency clients, prioritizing effectively and delivering on time

Welcome to SMG Vietnam!
SMG Swiss Marketplace Group simplifies lives with innovative online marketplaces in Automotive, Real Estate, General Marketplaces, and Finance & Insurance. As SMG‚Äôs innovation hub, SMG Vietnam develops cutting-edge solutions in a collaborative, empowering environment. Recognized among the 2023 Asia & Vietnam Best Workplaces, we attract top digital talent to create exceptional user experiences for Switzerland. Guided by our core values‚ÄîBetter Together, Aim High, and Act Responsibly‚Äîwe drive innovation and meaningful change.
 This job refers to our Real Estate brands, Homegate and Immoscout24, the largest real estate portals in Switzerland, with more than 15 million visits per month and more than 100,000 listings. We provide all users looking for a property with a transparent overview of the entire range of listings without them having to tediously visit different platforms. In addition to great products such as the mortgage or price calculator, we also offer editorial articles on topics such as housing and financing.
 We are looking for Full-stack engineers (backend-focused) (2 openings) to help us build the future of the Swiss real estate market by contributing to our cutting-edge, cloud-based technology stack. You will get to collaborate and access the wealth of knowledge and experience from a community of amazing engineers who come from all parts of the globe and are ready to share their expertise and aid you in your path to fulfilling your potential.
 Join our dynamic team, located in six countries (Switzerland, Serbia, Vietnam, France, Germany, and India), where creativity thrives. Together, we tackle challenges, celebrate successes, and keep learning and growing.
 Our tech stack
Our frontend is implemented with Vue.js / React, with Typescript as the language of choice. It consists of a mix of client-side, server-side, pre-rendered, and hybrid web apps.
Our backend is written in Node.js and Typescript, following a serverless and microservices architecture in a cloud-based environment using AWS. Our main services leverage Lambda, DynamoDB, SQS, SNS, and S3, among others. 
Our monitoring is done mainly through Datadog.
We adopt the latest developments in AI technology and expect our staff to embrace the innovation offered by large language models.
 Your Mission:
Innovate, design, implement, and deploy engineering solutions.
Contribute to projects and participate in planning, execution, and success.
Ask questions, brainstorm, and own the product we are building.
Work closely with the product and solve our users‚Äô problems by building the best products.
Be part of the team and establish credibility with the quality of your own and your team‚Äôs technical execution.
Your responsibilities will evolve as we grow.

job_description:
We‚Äôre GeoComply! We are at the forefront of geolocation, cybersecurity, and anti-fraud innovation, developing and delivering cutting-edge technologies to help ensure regulatory compliance, combat bad online actors, alleviate user friction, and protect businesses from fraud.
 Achieving significant business and revenue growth over the past three years and dubbed a tech ‚ÄúUnicorn,‚Äù GeoComply has been trusted by leading global brands and regulators for over ten years. Our compliance-grade geolocation technology solutions are installed on over 400 million devices and analyze over 12 billion transactions a year.
 At the heart of it all is the people, united by a deep commitment to problem-solving and revolutionizing how people and businesses use the internet to instill confidence in every online interaction. With teams across five countries, three continents, and a global customer base, we have no plans to slow down.
 We are opening 2 Senior Data Analyst positions for 2 different teams.
 1. Senior Data Analyst (PowerBI, English) - BI team
Are you passionate about using data to drive strategic business decisions? Would you like to be part of a team that shapes the future of our company by transforming data into actionable intelligence?
The Senior Data Analyst (Business Intelligence) will be a key member of the Business Intelligence team. Your primary responsibility is to drive GeoComply's evolution from a reactive, history-focused entity to a proactive, forward-looking, and data-driven enterprise. This role moves beyond standard reporting to answer not just "what happened," but "why did it happen," "what will happen," and most importantly, "what should we do about it?".
The ideal candidate has a strong analytical mind, deep business acumen, and a talent for telling compelling stories with data. You are a proactive problem-solver who is enthusiastic about conducting analysis to tackle complex business challenges.
Key Responsibilities
Take ownership of the entire BI project lifecycle. This includes gathering requirements from stakeholders, identifying and validating necessary data sources, building and maintaining data models, and designing intuitive, insightful dashboards (e.g Power BI, Databricks, Kibana)
Conduct analysis & collaborate with stakeholders to uncover the root causes, investigate underlying trends, and present not just what happened, but why it happened.
Present your findings to both technical and non-technical audiences. Create compelling narratives that use data to illustrate a business problem, the analysis you conducted, and your proposed solution
Work with respective product managers or department heads to develop production monitoring system; liaising with the CS, SD, PM, and AM teams to ensure they have the most up to date information to meet client needs
Guide and mentor junior analysts on the team, sharing best practices for data analysis, dashboard design, and data storytelling.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2. Senior Data Analyst (Python, SQL, English) - Performance team
As a Senior Data Analyst at GeoComply, you will be a key leader within our analytics function, responsible for driving significant insights and contributing directly to the strategic direction of our products and business. You will leverage your deep analytical expertise, technical proficiency, and business acumen to identify complex patterns, develop advanced analytical solutions, and provide actionable recommendations to stakeholders across the organization. You will also mentor junior analysts and play a crucial role in shaping our data-driven culture. This is an exciting opportunity to make a significant impact in a dynamic and rapidly evolving technology company.
 Key Responsibilities
Lead Complex Data Analysis: Independently design, execute, and interpret complex data analyses on large datasets to uncover critical insights related to fraud detection, compliance effectiveness, and customer behavior.
Develop Advanced Reporting & Dashboards: Design, develop, and automate sophisticated reports and interactive dashboards that provide clear, actionable intelligence to various business and technical teams.
Drive Rule Enhancement & Optimization: Proactively identify opportunities to enhance and optimize our anti-fraud and compliance rules based on in-depth data analysis and a thorough understanding of evolving threats.
Champion Data Quality & Integrity: Establish and promote best practices for data collection, validation, and integrity, ensuring the accuracy and reliability of our analytical outputs.
Investigate Emerging Threats: Lead research and investigation into new and sophisticated geo-blocking bypass methodologies and fraud tactics, developing strategies for detection and mitigation.
Design & Implement Analytical Solutions: Architect and implement end-to-end analytical solutions, including data pipelines, statistical models, and advanced querying techniques.
Collaborate & Influence: Partner effectively with product, engineering, operations, and other business teams to understand their needs, translate them into analytical requirements, and present findings and recommendations with clarity and impact.
Mentor & Guide: Provide mentorship and guidance to junior data analysts, fostering their technical and analytical growth and promoting a collaborative team environment.
Contribute to Product Strategy: Leverage data insights to contribute to the strategic direction of our products, identifying opportunities for new features, improvements, and optimizations.
Stay Current with Industry Trends: Continuously research and evaluate new data analytics tools, techniques, and industry best practices to ensure GeoComply remains at the forefront of data-driven innovation.

job_description:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Join our Technology Innovations Center of Excellence (CoE) at Crossian, a fast-growing startup that achieved a milestone of $100M in 2024. In this dynamic role, you'll check in daily with your team to stay aligned on project goals and collaborate across our ecosystem with an Agile mindset infused with a unicorn-worthy startup culture.
We are building a cutting-edge Global eCommerce Platform, offering end-to-end solutions for:
Storefront: Designing customizable and scalable online store systems that provide seamless shopping experiences and support dynamic business growth.
Ads Manager: Integrating and optimizing advertising tools across platforms like Facebook, Google and more, enabling businesses to launch, track, and analyze marketing campaigns efficiently.
Marketing Insights & CRM: Turning raw data from marketing campaigns, transactions, and user behavior into actionable insights to enhance customer engagement and drive smarter decision-making.
WHAT YOU WILL DO
As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for the following tasks and duties:
Strategic Analysis & Insight Generation:
Collect, clean, and analyze data from diverse sources, including user behavior metrics, campaign performance metrics, and customer engagement metrics.
Manage data from A/B testing, including user tracking event data, aggregating and splitting it into multiple versions for analysis.
Develop hypotheses and provide actionable insights to improve storefront experiences, optimize ad campaigns, enhance customer retention strategies, and evaluate the effectiveness of new features or content through AB testing.
When comparing versions in AB testing, provide the confidence level of the results, determine the required number of views (users) and duration for the test to achieve statistically significant outcomes. Define the Definition of Done (DoD) for the two versions A and B in the experiments.
Utilize data visualization techniques to create charts and dashboards that communicate key trends and support decision-making for cross-functional teams.
Dashboard & BI Development:
Build and maintain real-time BI dashboards to track critical metrics such as conversion rates, customer lifetime value, and results from A/B tests.
Assist in the creation of a self-service BI system, enabling teams to explore data and generate reports tailored to their needs, including monitoring and analyzing A/B tests.
Data Management & Integration:
Define and manage data schemas for eCommerce-specific objects (e.g., product catalogs, tracking user events) and data from A/B tests to optimize data accessibility for analysis.
Ensure the data warehouse maintains high data quality standards, is optimized for performance, and meets the needs of our global platform, including supporting analyses from A/B testing
Team Collaboration:
Collaboration with Team Members: Work closely with team members to comprehend data requirements and deliver appropriate data solutions to meet business needs.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Engage with cross-functional teams to support and facilitate data-driven decision-making throughout the organization.
By undertaking these responsibilities, you will play a crucial role in driving data-informed decisions and strategies, ultimately contributing to the success and growth of our organization.

job_title: Middle & Senior Data Engineer (Python, SQL, AI)
job_description:
About Galaxy Joy 
Galaxy Joy operates Vietnam's leading loyalty platform, powering the Vietjet SkyJoy program andconnecting over 250 brand partners across thecountry. As we expand across ASEAN,we're building a world-class data infrastructure from the ground up to support real-time transaction processing, partner integrations, and data-driven decision making at scale
Job Description: 
We're looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join our growing data team and play a central role in transforming our data infrastructure into a modern, scalable platform. This is a hands-on leadership position where you'll own critical deliverables, drive architectural decisions, and help establish best practices as we build out our medallion architecture. You'll work across the full data stack, from ingestion and orchestration through transformation andanalytics, and have significant influence over how we design and operate our data platform.
1.Platform Modernization
You will drive the transformation of legacy systems into our modern data architecture. This includes championing engineering best practices such as code reviews, documentation, and testing, as well as mentoring junior team members andcontributing to building our data engineering culture.
2. Data Ingestion and Orchestration
You will design, develop, and maintain robust data pipelines using Apache Airflow and Python. This includes building and optimizing DAGs for ingesting data from brand partners with varying formats anddelivery methods. You'll ensure data quality and reliability at the point of ingestion with proper validation and error handling.
3. Data Transformation and Processing
You will own heavy data transformation workloads, translating complex business requirements into efficient Spark jobs. job_description:
We are seeking an AI Engineer to join our team and specialize in developing LLM-powered (multi-)agents. In this role, you will design, build, and optimize intelligent agents that can reason, plan, and interact with both structured and unstructured data. You will work with large-scale language models (LLMs) and integrate them with tools, APIs, and external systems to create autonomous, reliable, and context-aware workflows. 
A key responsibility will be designing pipelines that prepare and structure information for LLM consumption‚Äîincluding retrieval, embeddings, and context optimization‚Äîso agents can perform multi-step tasks effectively. You may also design multi-agent systems for complex or multi-functional use cases that require collaboration between specialized agents. 
You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to push the boundaries of applied generative AI and deliver scalable AI-agent solutions
Design and develop LLM-powered (multi-)agents capable of reasoning,  planning, and executing tasks across diverse domains.
Build and maintain pipelines for data ingestion, knowledge retrieval, embeddings, and context optimization to make information consumable by LLMs.
Integrate LLM agents with tools and APIs, enabling them to interact with external systems in real-world applications.
Continuously improve and optimize pipelines for scalability, robustness, and performance in production environments.
Benchmark agent performance and outputs, ensuring accuracy, reliability, and safety.
Fine-tune and serve local LLMs and embedding models to support domain specific use cases and optimize inference.
Conduct research and experimentation to advance capabilities in multi-agent systems, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and tool-augmented LLMs.
Stay updated with state-of-the-art (SOTA) advancements in generative AI, agentic frameworks, and reinforcement learning with human feedback (RLHF)
your_skills_experience:
2+ years of experience in Machine Learning or NLP, with at least 1+ year of hands-on experience developing LLM-powered agents.
Strong proficiency in Python and ML/NLP libraries (e.g., Hugging Face Transformers, LangChain, LlamaIndex, PyTorch, TensorFlow).
Solid understanding of modern deep learning architectures such as Transformers and attention-based models.
Experience in deploying ML/LLM models into production, ensuring reliability, scalability, and efficient inference.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to translate research into production-ready solutions.
Effective communication and collaboration skills to work across cross-functional teams.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience in fine-tuning LLMs for domain-specific tasks.
Hands-on experience with prompt optimization tools (e.g., DSPy, Guidance, or similar).
Experience in building complex or multi-agent systems, including orchestration across specialized agents.
Strong understanding of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) techniques, including chunking, embeddings, and vector databases.
Familiarity with MLOps practices for LLM deployment, monitoring, and optimization.

job_description:
FinOS Technology is a fintech company with the mission to provide simple, affordable and tech-enable financial products & service thought all digital ecosytem.
Model Development & Optimization
Maintain and enhance existing AI models for OCR on Vietnamese ID cards (CCCD) and extend to other document types (passports, driver licenses, bank documents).
Fine-tune and adapt state-of-the-art OCR/document models (Donut) for production use.
Optimize training and inference pipelines for performance, scalability, and cost efficiency.
Data Pipeline & Quality Management
Manage large datasets combining synthetic and real-world document images.
Build preprocessing and augmentation pipelines: image quality checks, blur/rotation detection, Vietnamese text normalization, PII masking.
Ensure data quality and evaluation consistency across multiple document types.
Accuracy & Performance Evaluation
Define and monitor evaluation metrics: character/word accuracy, exact match rate, edit distance, latency.
Analyze failed predictions (e.g., accents, truncated fields, misrecognized entities) and integrate findings into retraining cycles.
Implement image/document quality control to prevent poor inputs from degrading OCR accuracy.
Production & Monitoring
Deploy, monitor, and maintain OCR models serving production workloads (100k+ documents/month).
Investigate and resolve production failures, manage rollbacks, and improve system robustness.
Collaborate with backend engineers to integrate OCR APIs with downstream systems.
Collaboration & Leadership
Mentor junior engineers in computer vision and OCR best practices.
Contribute to the long-term roadmap for Document AI, beyond ID cards, to support broader fintech/eKYC and document processing needs.
Document experiments, model updates, and operational practices.

Trusting Social is an AI Fintech pioneer that's revolutionizing credit access in emerging markets. Our mission is "Advancing AI to Meet the Financial Needs of Everyday Consumers with Empathy." We've assessed over 1 billion consumers across four countries, and we're on a mission to provide 100 million credit lines using the power of AI and Big Data.
How You'll Make an Impact
As a Data Scientist, eKYC at Trusting Social, you will be instrumental in building cutting-edge digital identity verification products for our eKYC (electronic Know Your Customer) projects. Your expertise in machine learning and computer vision will be crucial for developing robust systems to prevent fraud and money laundering. This role offers the opportunity to make a significant impact on revenue while also enhancing financial security, aligning with our strong social mission.
What You'll Do
Develop Advanced ML Models: Build various machine learning models in computer vision, implementing novel solutions for diverse ML problems (supervised, semi-supervised, unsupervised, one-class).
Research & Implement Cutting-Edge Algorithms: Research, design, and implement advanced ML models and algorithms to solve practical problems, optimizing for both performance and speed.
Build Practical Vision Systems: Work with high-dimensional image and video data to develop practical vision systems with a direct impact on revenue and profitability.
Optimize for Deployment: Optimize and deploy "tiny" ML solutions for limited computation power devices like mobile and web platforms.

- Management Design and implement automated deployment, configuration management, and lifecycle management for nodes, control panels, certificates, and databases to improve operational efficiency and consistency.

- Plan, deploy, and continuously optimize global routing for nodes (BGP / CN2 GIA / Tunnel), ensuring minimal latency and packet loss for end users.

5. Monitoring & Performance Tuning 
- Build and maintain comprehensive monitoring (Prometheus / Grafana) and logging systems (ELK / Loki). 
- Perform kernel-level and application-level optimization to improve overall system performance.

- Experience with Terraform, Cloud-init, or other Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) tools. 

3. Monitoring & Security 
- Hands-on experience in building and maintaining Prometheus + Grafana monitoring and alerting systems, including writing custom metrics. 
- Practical experience in DDoS/CC attack mitigation, with knowledge of high-protection services (Cloudflare Magic Transit, Alibaba Cloud Anti-DDoS, etc.). 
- Familiarity with Linux security hardening, permission management, and auditing procedures. 

Qualifications & Soft Skills 
- Educational background in Computer Science, Network Engineering, or related fields preferred. 
- 2‚Äì4 years of experience in SRE / DevOps roles within internet or network-service companies. 
- Strong sense of responsibility for system high availability; capable of making quick decisions and resolving issues under pressure.
- Ability to work independently, handle complex operational tasks, and continuously explore and learn new technologies.
- Must be willing and able to participate in 24/7 on-call rotation, responding promptly to emergencies.

job_description:

Proven experience in architecting, designing, and migrating workloads to public cloud environments

Self-starter accustomed to working in a fast-paced, collaborative team environment
Proficient technical communication skills in English and Korean
